sourceText: The Secret Teachings of All Ages; The Philosophy of Astrology; Astrological Keywords
note: Hall's synthesis as a self-identified Rosicrucian Christian, shaped by Blavatsky and Max Heindel's Rosicrucian Cosmo-Conception. His distinctive contribution is compiling the Neoplatonic seven souls (the qualities the soul acquires descending through the planetary spheres) alongside standard Western esoteric correspondences into a single unified framework. He said of Blavatsky: 'Take away her contribution and all modern occultism falls like a house of cards.'

Saturn.descentQuality: Reason and intellect — the soul acquires the power of contemplation and abstract thought

Jupiter.descentQuality: Judgment and governance — the soul acquires the power to order, administer, and rule wisely

Mars.descentQuality: Courage and spiritedness — the soul acquires the capacity for action, aggression, and will

Sun.descentQuality: Life and consciousness — the soul acquires vitality, the spark of individual awareness

Venus.descentQuality: Love and attraction — the soul acquires the power to desire, unite, and create through relationship

Mercury.descentQuality: Speech and communication — the soul acquires the faculty of language, analysis, and exchange

Moon.descentQuality: Generation and instinct — the soul acquires the power of physical reproduction and bodily growth
